main event: A round silver disc object was observed stationary over Syracuse, New York for approximately 6 minutes on 29 April 1953.
interesting points: The object was not classified as a balloon, meteorite, or aircraft.,The observation lasted 6 minutes and was conducted from the ground.,The object was reported to be at an altitude estimated between 12,222 to 15,222 feet.,Three female observers reported the sighting, although their names were not provided.,Weather conditions during the observation were described as good with unlimited visibility.
